Title: PK11195 enhances chemosensitivity to cisplatin and paclitaxel in human endometrial and ovarian cancer cells
Citation Text: 1:Normal endometrial epithelial cells were separated from stromal cells by digesting the tissue fragments with collagenase, as described (23)*. 2:Cells were prepared for FACS as described above and stained using the Mitocapture Apoptosis Detection Kit obtained from Biovision (Palo Alto, CA, USA) with a fluorescent lipophilic cationic reagent that assesses mitochondrial membrane permeability according to the manufacturer's recommendation as described (23)*. 3:The cell cycle was analyzed by flow cytometry after 3 days of culturing, as described (23)*. Cells (5x104) were exposed to PK11195, cisplatin or paclitaxel in 6-well, flat-bottomed plates for 72 h.

Title: Interactions of alkylphosphocholines with model membranes-the Langmuir monolayer study
Citation Text: These membrane-targeted drugs, before affecting vital functions inside the cell-such as cell proliferation, cell cycle progression, differentiation, invasion and angiogenesis (Takai et al. 2008)* have to penetrate through the biomembrane. So far, little is known about how APCs interact with membrane constituents.

Title: Targeting of polo-like kinases and their cross talk with Aurora kinases--possible therapeutic strategies in human acute myeloid leukemia?
Citation Text: Several PLK inhibitors have been identified, especially PLK1 inhibitors [45], including the small molecules scytonemin, BI2536, thiophene benzimidazole compound 1, pyrimidine derivative DAP-81, ON01910, TAL, GW843682X, erucylphosphocholine, thiophene benzamidazole, p16INK4a and LFM-A13 (Tables 3 and 5 for detailed information and additional references) [58-70]. Some of these drugs have been studied only in experimental models and may have mainly indirect effects on the cell cycle machinery, for example, erucylphosphocholine that is a membrane-targeted, lipophilic ether lipid of synthetic phospholipid analog that induces apoptosis in certain human tumor cell lines [71]. The antimalarial drug chloroquine also seems to affect the PLK1 protein level and activity in cancer cells [72], and PLKs can also be inhibited by the phosphatidylinositol-3 kinase (PI3K) inhibitor wortmannin [73].

Title: Synthesis of structural analogues of hexadecylphosphocholine and their antineoplastic, antimicrobial and amoebicidal activity
Citation Text: The leading compound miltefosine (hexadecylphosphocholine, HPC) is used for topical application in patients with skin metastases of breast cancer [2]. These compounds exhibit inhibitory capacity against tumour cells derived from different malignant localisations, such as breast [10] and ovarian [11,12]* cancer. HPC have a co-stimulatory effect on granulopoiesis and thrombocytopoiesis [9], which is in contrast with bone-marrow suppression typical for most chemotherapeutical regimens.

Title: Apoptosis induction by erucylphosphohomocholine via the 18 kDa mitochondrial translocator protein: implications for cancer treatment
Citation Text: In contrast to the strong cytostatic and cytotoxic effects against a multitude of tumor cell lines, there is an apparent lack of cytotoxicity of ErPC / ErPC3 on nonmalignant cells [8, 25, 50, 57, 58]*. Most importantly, no bone marrow toxicity induced by APCs has been observed in vivo.

Title: Synthesis of N-methylpiperidin-4-one derivatives and evaluation of their anti-endometrial cancer activity
Citation Text: The appearance of symptoms early in the course explains why most women with endometrial cancer have early-stage disease at presentation. For all stages taken together, the overall 5-year survival is around 80% [5, 6]*.
